body.p: Introduction to JALv2 code writing & formatting.

section.title: Intro to JALv2/Jallib code format
section.p: The JALv2 language is free-format (there is no separator character between lines), and is not case-sensitive. All characters with an ASCII value below the space (tab, carriage return, new line, form feed, etc.) are treated as spaces, except that the end of a line terminates a comment.

Although JALv2 is not case sensitive, it is a good idea to keep some consistency in your writing. Jallib has come up with a "Style Guide" which basically involves all lower case, with "_" characters between words in variables. An example of a variable would be in the form: hello_world
Jallib also specifies that 3 spaces should be used for indenting.
You may read more about the Jallib Style Guide here: http://www.justanotherlanguage.org/content/jsg
section.codeblock:
-- if statement in preferred format if hello_a > hello_b then hello_a = hello_b + 1 else hello_a = hello_b - 1 end if
-- but this has exactly the same effect if hello_a > hello_b then hello_a = hello_b + 1 else hello_a = hello_b - 1 end if
